etymologies: mid 16th century; earliest use found in John Olde (d. 1557), translator and religious controversialist. From Byzantine Greek παραϕραστής from Hellenistic Greek παραϕράζειν to paraphrase (from ancient Greek παρα- + ϕράζειν to explain, make known) + -της, suffix forming agent nouns

definitions: A person who paraphrases or makes a paraphrase; = "paraphraser".
